medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until 19 years earlier, when rib pain developed and a left metatarsal stress fracture occurred while running. Symptoms resolved after phosphate supplements and calcitriol, but recurred nine years before this evaluation along with back and rib pain, stress fractures, fatigue, muscle weakness, and intermittent wheezing. The patient has not experienced fever, sweats, or new intestinal symptoms. Bilateral hip pain was reported when walking.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of cutaneous mastocytosis for 30 years, asymptomatic nephrolithiasis noted in the past 5 years, and a tonsillectomy as a child. Previously diagnosed with osteomalacia characterized by Looser zones in forefoot radiographs.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's parents were deceased; mother had lung cancer, father had prostate cancer, brother had melanoma, and sister was healthy.
medical_history.social_history: The patient is married and lives with his wife and children. He works in journalism, drinks alcohol in moderation, and does not smoke or use illicit drugs. He has traveled to Europe.
